TOOLTIP.Name: What is the long readable name for this PDF?
TOOLTIP.Code: What is the short code that will be used to open this PDF?
TOOLTIP.URL: Which PDF file should be opened?
TOOLTIP.PageOffset: When you ask the system to open a page, how much should the page be offset by so the page opens correctly?
TOOLTIP.EnableCaching: Should this PDF be cached on a player's computer after being opened? This may save bandwidth, but will require storage space on the user's computer.
TOOLTIP.PDFType: See the manual for a description of PDF types.

LABEL.Name: PDF Name
LABEL.TestSettings: When you click this button, your PDF should open to page 5. If it doesn't, close the PDF, then adjust the page offset until it does.

PLACEHOLDER.Name: The Guide to Loot!
PLACEHOLDER.URL: A relative path from your data directory.

VIEWER.ShowToPlayersTitle: Press SHIFT to show to ALL players except yourself.

ERROR.NoPDFWithCode: Unable to find PDF with specified code.
ERROR.NoPDFWithName: Unable to find PDF with specified name.
ERROR.PageMustBePositive: Page must be greater than or equal to 1.
ERROR.FileNotFound: Error opening PDF: The file was not found on the server.

ENRICH.EmptyLinkText: Link text is required for @PDF tags.

SETTINGS.CacheSizeHint: How many MB of hard drive space should be allowed to be taken up by the PDF cache? Must be between 64 and 1024 inclusive.
SETTINGS.ViewerThemeHint: Which theme should the viewer use? Changes will only only affect newly opened viewers.
SETTINGS.ShowInExistingViewerName: Show Shared PDFs in Existing Viewer
SETTINGS.ShowInExistingViewerHint: If enabled, when another player shows a PDF to you, if you have the PDF open already the page will change instead of opening a new window.

DANGER.Safe: This path is likely to be safe to use.
DANGER.Low: This path is unlikely to be dangerous, but you should use caution.
DANGER.High: This path is very likely to cause issues if used.
DANGER.Critical: You should never use this path under any circumstances!

COMMANDS.Failure: PDFoundry: $COMMAND_NAME$ encountered an error. See the console for additional details.
COMMANDS.FixMissingTypesSuccess: Fixed PDFs with missing type definitions.
COMMANDS.FixMissingTypesFailure: No PDFs with missing type definitions found.
